body.head.byline: By KATHRYN SHATTUCK; Compiled by Ben Sisario

abstract.p: Arts, Briefly column; Signature Theater Co will hold gala tribute to playwright Paula Vogel on April 4; Roundabout Theater Co will present Jason Robards Award to Stephen Sondheim and present musical tribute on April 11 (S)

block.p: Some of the brightest in New York theater will toast two of their own in galas next month. On April 4 the Signature Theater Company will honor Paula Vogel, its 2004-5 playwright in residence, at the Ritz-Carlton New York. Maureen McGovern, currently portraying Marmee in ''Little Women,'' will perform, while Edward Albee, Lee Blessing, John Guare, Cherry Jones, Romulus Linney, Kenneth Lonergan, Edward Norton, Molly Ringwald and Basil Twist are to pay tribute to Ms. Vogel, who won the Pulitzer Prize in 1998 for ''How I Learned to Drive.'' On April 11 the Roundabout Theater Company will present the Jason Robards Award to Stephen Sondheim at Chelsea Piers. Scott Ellis will direct a musical tribute to Mr. Sondheim, with a cast including Christine Baranski, Polly Bergen, Michael Cerveris, Alan Cumming, Judith Ivey, LaChanze, Cyndi Lauper, Debra Monk, Donna Murphy and Bernadette Peters. Over the years the Roundabout has revived four of Mr. Sondheim's musicals: ''Company,'' ''Follies,'' last season's Tony-winning ''Assassins'' and this season's ''Pacific Overtures.''
